actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Education, Arts, and Humanities

official_title: A bill to provide financial assistance to expand the availability of child care services for college students, particularly low-income students, in order to increase the access of such students to institutions of higher education, and for other purposes.
short_title: College-Based Child Care Programs for Students Act
subjects: Federal aid to day care centers

summary.text: College-Based Child Care Programs for Students Act - Amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to add a new title XII, College-Based Child Care Programs. (Redesignates the current title XII as title XIII.) Authorizes appropriations for FY 1986 through 1990 for grants to institutions of higher education for: (1) construction, reconstruction, and renovation of facilities, located at such institutions, to be used to provide child care services (free for students from families with incomes less than 150 percent of the poverty level, and with a sliding-scale of fees based on income for other students participating); (2) child care services through vouchers for disadvantaged college students (with two-thirds of the participants to be low-income students who are first generation college students, and the remainder, to be either low-income or first generation college students); and (3) child care personnel work-experience programs (which provide experience for students by arranging part-time employment for them in licensed child care programs).

titles.title: College-Based Child Care Programs for Students Act

A bill to provide financial assistance to expand the availability of child care services for college students, particularly low-income students, in order to increase the access of such students to institutions of higher education, and for other purposes.
